# Include some data examples in your package

# Functions to generate color palettes

## Extract hex-code of colors specified in a tibble

```{r examples-get_color_hex_code}
datafile <- system.file("mycolors.csv", 
                        package = "stadlColorPaletteR")
mycolors <- readr::read_csv(datafile)
get_color_hex_code('palevioletred2', base_colors = mycolors)

```

## Generate colors for later interpolation

```{r examples-generate_colors_to_interpolate}
datafile <- system.file("mycolors.csv", 
                        package = "stadlColorPaletteR")
mycolors <- readr::read_csv(datafile)

# combinations with 2 colors
generate_colors_to_interpolate(mycolors, 2)

#combinations with all colors
generate_colors_to_interpolate(mycolors, nrow(mycolors))

```

## Access and interpolate colors

```{r examples-color_palette}
datafile <- system.file("mycolors.csv", 
                        package = "stadlColorPaletteR")
mycolors <- readr::read_csv(datafile)

# combinations with 2 colors
base_cols <- generate_colors_to_interpolate(mycolors, 2)

# interpolate first element of base_cols
mycolors_interpolated <- color_palette(
  colors_to_interpolate = 'pal1',
  base_colors = base_cols
)
```

## Create scales for ggplot

```{r examples-scale_color_stadl}
require(ggplot2)
datafile <- system.file("mycolors.csv", 
                        package = "stadlColorPaletteR")
mycolors <- readr::read_csv(datafile)
ggplot(iris, 
       aes(Sepal.Width, Sepal.Length, color = Species)) +
  geom_point(size = 2, alpha = 1) +
  scale_color_stadl('pal1', generate_colors_to_interpolate(mycolors,3)) +
  ggtitle("stadl")+theme_minimal()

```
